page.title: 03Village Nuclear Relations
page.content: Liaison committees meetings between BNFL and County & Parish councillors visits around the factory & provision of a team of speakers make for good relationships & residents appear to have no worries over its proximity. Indeed many take advantage of associate membership to use its social & sporting facilities including the WI who partake in BNFL's Gala Day use the Club ballroom for area group meetings & play bowls on the green.Local organisations & hospitals benefit from grants & fund raising efforts & the Capenhurst Church roof appeal received a grant & free loan of scaffolding. Annual anti nuclear demonstrations & a peace camp 1982.1983 disrupt the quiet of the villiage but are normally peaceful although residents resent the vandalising of of property such as the railway station by such groups.
